I know exactly what you are talking about! I fucking hate it when people teach math using slides!

the thing is, he's not really trying to teach those equations, they're background. The students will need to understand the concepts but they aren't the point of the lecture, he's trying to get them out of the way, he's saying "Look, these exist, you have to take them into account, but lets spend the lecturer going over what I wanted to teach beyond that." Half of university is figuring out what will be on the exam or not, what's actually important to the subject. He's not teaching math, log just make something linear and easier to see a trend, then there's the errors from the actual data and different theories of how to measure/compensate for it.

completely false , writing on the board is anti-mathematical and a huge waste of time in many senses. slides when used properly are time-saving leaving more room for deeper explanation. ( and this stems too simply from that one can't write and read at the same time).
